conclusion: Determine the work done by the frictional force on the object from point M to point N.
Calculate frictional force f = mu * m * g = 9 N.
Calculate acceleration a = f / m = 3 m/s².
Determine time t for object to reach conveyor speed using v = u + at, t = 2 s.
Calculate distance s traveled while accelerating using s = ut + 1/2 * at², s = 6 m.
Determine remaining distance d = L1 - s = 4 m.
Calculate work W1 done by friction during acceleration, W1 = f * s = 54 J.
Calculate work W2 done by friction during constant speed, W2 = 0 J.
Calculate total work W = W1 + W2 = 54 J.
Final answer: Work done by friction is 54 J.
